quotes.quote: Their complete lack of contrition and remorse borders on pathological.
quotes.speaker: Arthur Engoron
quotes.description: Describing Donald Trump and his co-defendants in his ruling.

quotes.quote: Defendants did not commit murder or arson. They did not rob a bank at gunpoint. Donald Trump is not Bernard Madoff. Yet, defendants are incapable of admitting the error of their ways.
quotes.speaker: Arthur Engoron
quotes.description: Highlighting the nature of Trump's actions compared to other crimes and the defendants' lack of contrition.

quotes.quote: The Court found his testimony credible, based on the relaxed manner in which he testified, the general plausibility of his statements, and, most importantly, the way his testimony was corroborated by other trial evidence.
quotes.speaker: Arthur Engoron
quotes.description: On finding Michael Cohen's testimony credible.

quotes.quote: ignored the law, ignored the facts
quotes.speaker: Christopher Kise
quotes.description: Contesting Judge Engoron's ruling against Donald Trump.

quotes.quote: To err is human, to forgive is divine. Defendants apparently are of a different mind.
quotes.speaker: Arthur Engoron
quotes.description: Using a quote from Alexander Pope to characterize defendants' lack of contrition.

Takeaways from the $355 million civil fr.summary: Judge Arthur Engoron fined Donald Trump $355 million for fraudulent activities concerning property values and barred him from directorship roles in New York for three years. This, combined with a prior $83 million defamation judgment related to E. Jean Carroll, sums up to roughly $438 million in fines over four weeks. The ruling addressed Trump's financial statement fraud, false business records, and conspiracy. Trump's sons Eric and Donald Jr. were also barred from executive roles for two years. Trump's attorney plans to appeal the decision, which could prolong the legal proceedings.

NRA trial: Deliberations begin in civil.summary: The jury in the civil corruption trial against the NRA and its top executives will continue deliberations on Tuesday. The New York attorney general's office accuses them of corruption and misusing funds. Wayne LaPierre, the former CEO, stepped down, denying financial motives and claiming expenses advanced the NRA's influence.
key_takeaways: The jury will resume deliberation in the NRA's civil corruption trial on April 25.
Wayne LaPierre and other executives accused of mass corruption and misuse of NRA funds.
LaPierre denies wrongdoing, claims expenses were for bolstering NRA influence.

Caitlin Clark-onomics and the new era of.summary: Caitlin Clark is recognized as women's college basketball's all-time leading scorer and has become an economic powerhouse in college sports with a multi-million dollar earning potential. She has endorsement deals with major brands, and her presence has substantially increased interest and revenue in women's college sports. The 2021 Supreme Court ruling on NIL (name, image, and likeness) has allowed college athletes to monetize their personal brand, leading to hitherto unprecedented levels of profitability for athletes, especially women, whose professional sports salaries are traditionally much lower than their male counterparts.
key_takeaways: Caitlin Clark became women's college basketball's all-time leading scorer.
Clark's endorsement deals and stardom are increasing profitability in women's college sports.
A 2021 Supreme Court ruling on NIL has empowered college athletes to earn from their personal brand.

Gwen Stefani says she has to relearn No.summary: Gwen Stefani acknowledges the need to relearn No Doubt's classic songs before their Coachella reunion. She discussed her preparations on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live,' joking about potential lyrical lapses.
key_takeaways: Gwen Stefani is relearning No Doubt songs for the Coachella reunion.
No Doubt's last performance was nearly a decade ago.
Coachella 2023 features several other top artists.
